{"step_by_step_thinking": "Model plaster (white) is largely composed of calcium sulfate hemihydrate (CaSO4 • ½H2O). This is because model plaster is a type of dental stone that is used to create study models in dentistry. Calcium sulfate hemihydrate is the main component of dental stone, which is a form of gypsum. It is mixed with water to create a paste that can be poured into a mold and then hardens to form a solid model. Therefore, the correct answer is C. CaSO4 • ½H2O.", "answer_choice": "C"}
